channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Washington Journal
channel.desc: A forum for leading journalists and public policy makers to discuss key events and legislation.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Founding Fathers & Civics
channel.desc: Things to learn from the Founding Fathers about civic literacy, civility and civic engagement; National Constitution Center President and CEO Jeffrey Rosen leads a discussion exploring these ideas.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Unprecedented coverage of the U.S. semiquincentennial with live events, expert insights, and exclusive access to historic sites, documents, and reenactments-celebrating 250 years of American history and democracy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This National Association of Manufacturers film was produced during the Great Depression to promote an optimistic view of the U.S. economy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Key Capitol Hill Hearings
channel.desc: Hearings, speeches and political coverage from around the United States.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Key Capitol Hill Hearings
channel.desc: Hearings, speeches and political coverage from around the United States.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: National Archives Curator Jessie Kratz discusses a rare exhibit of the entire U.S. Constitution.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Tim Weiner, the Mission - The CIA in the 21st Century
channel.desc: Tim Weiner discusses the history and evolution of the Central Intelligence Agency from the end of the Cold War through the first quarter of the 21st century.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: A look at the people and events that shaped the American Civil War and Reconstruction.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Author James Fichter talks about the role and politics of tea leading up to the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Lebanon Valley College professor James Broussard teaches a class on the lead-up to the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: William and Mary Bray School Lab director Maureen Elgersman Lee discusses the history of the 18th-century Williamsburg Bray School for Black children and the legacies of the 300 to 400 scholars it enrolled.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Book TV
channel.desc: This long-running staple of the C-SPAN2 weekend schedule helps expand the channel's programming beyond politics. Most episodes of "Book TV" feature discussions with authors of nonfiction books, usually in the form of interviews, lectures or seminars. The series sometimes includes coverage of major book fairs and festivals. Some of the notable names who have appeared on the show include David Mamet and Tom Clancy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Classroom lectures on American history.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: American History TV
channel.desc: Airing weekends, "American History TV" offers programming about people and events that document the American story, geared toward history aficionados. Shows that air under the "American History TV" banner cover the history of the nation, from its founding in the 18th century through modern times. Topics covered include the Civil War, presidents and the exploration of historical sites.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: Historic speeches of former U.S. presidents as well as their policies and legacies.
